meanings.definition: To shrink back, as in fear or disgust.
meanings.sent1: The little dog cringes when it hears thunder.
meanings.sent2: She cringes at the thought of spiders.
meanings.sent3: He cringes at the sight of broccoli on his plate.
meanings.sent4: The cat cringes away from the vacuum cleaner like it's a monster.
meanings.sent5: The child cringes away from the loud noise, covering their ears.

meanings.definition: To react with embarrassment or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: She cringes when she remembers her awkward fall in front of everyone.
meanings.sent2: He cringes at the thought of his old fashion choices.
meanings.sent3: The comedian cringes at his own bad joke.
meanings.sent4: The student cringes as the teacher points out their mistake in front of the class.
meanings.sent5: The actor cringes at the memory of his forgotten lines on stage.

meanings.definition: To feel intense dislike or aversion.
meanings.sent1: He cringes at the taste of the bitter medicine.
meanings.sent2: She cringes at the idea of eating raw onions.
meanings.sent3: The baby cringes at the sound of the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: The detective cringes at the thought of working on another boring case.
meanings.sent5: The chef cringes at the sight of spoiled ingredients in the kitchen.
